channel.title: UBI Progress
channel.description:
well this seems to be the only place i can report advances bc my site is socket flooded.
[img]http://img64.imageshack.us/img64/2615/example1ep.jpg[/img]
UBI and future I-Bot can be started/stopped indivdually per java runtime not java applet.
Also UBI is completely stable with this new release. Although never heard of RC1 failing. Most issues seem to be with scar and SRL being slow
Looking for people with SWT experience, and java bufferedimage experience

item.title: UBI Progress
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

well ubi is a color clicker bot that recieves commands from scar to click and click that. This allows multi clients

i-bot is a next generation color clicker that is built on top of UBI. It currently grabs bitmap with awt.robot but i am looking at modifying the jdk awt.canvas and making it double buffered.

Read full topic

item.title: UBI Progress
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

I hate helping you guys, but I suppose seeing as it’s free this time,

  1. You spelt gtebottommessage wrong
  2. wouldn’t it be MUCH easier to find an object with the text in the top-left instead of a bitmap

Perhaps generating javadocs would be easier than making a big list =/

Read full topic

item.title: UBI Progress
item.dc:creator: @GenoDemoN GenoDemoN
item.description:
@GenoDemoN wrote:

I-Bot CORE Functions//Requirements

===ALL With tolerances===
==Color finding==
Findcolorspiral -in rectangular area
+movement # of frames to look @ for nulling of non changeing pixels,, additional tolerance is optional for the nulling out processing
+colortype- 32 bit 16 bit 8 bit 2 bit analyzation
+exclude areas array input of rectangles of ares to exclude from search
+frame number
--return: x,y,frame#

findobjspiral -in rectangular area
+bitmap
+x1,y1,x2,y2 box that contains an array of colors
+Model-- input of mutlible bitmaps and looks @ last few frames for the bitmaps
--return: x,y(of top left corner of obj),% match,frame#

==Text read Functions==
gettextat -+-font style select (there are 2-3 fonts i think in the game all charsets nicely made with srl+scar :) )
+input for % of pixels of letters found
+input for string character length to read
--returns: stringfound,frame#

istextat/in -+-font style select (there are 2-3 fonts i think in the game all charsets nicely made with srl+scar :) )
+input for % of pixels of letters found
+defined x1,y1 searchs for string to the right of the x1 and down from y1 to x2 and y2
--returns: true if found,x,y,frame#

getingamemessage # from newest to return
+ the yellow text shown on the game screen
--returns: yellow message found # back

getbottummessage # from newest
+ save last few messages for easy retriveval
--returns: # from newest message on lower text

==Interaction Functions==
movemouse --move to destination (spline)
clickmouse --movethenclick
holdmouse --to drag something around
releasemouse
keyboardclick (must be able to handle the shift key for characters like $ or @ for example)

==Script coding dependent functions==
sleepreturn --sleeps for ms but returns to specified location
sleepend --sleeps and returns to begining of script cycle
log --logs string to file for de-bug or stats

==Script Dialogue Settings==
displaysettingdialogue
+(Title,array of(Question,default input)) returns array of (question,enteredinput)
+Displays title follwed by list of questions with thier respective inputs then a Start Script Button
--at which the function retruns an array of the inputed info
Savesetting(script,setting)
loadsetting(script,setting)
displaystats(Title,array of (Lines to display))
updatestats(line#,string to replace line with)
++Both Stats programs then save the deltas of the values to some stat mem registray 
++at script launch dispatch stats to stat server :)

==Specific rs functions==
rsminimapangle
mousetrailcolor (Max time to follow,speed to follow)
+mouse mousetowards color as defined in incial area 
+then as color mass moves it follows it 
--returns: x,y(at first move to)x,y(last move to)

Rough sectch any sugs?

Read full topic
